title: Two Chinese Startups Tried to Catch Up to Makers of Advanced Computer Chips—and Failed
sub_head: Foundries with ties to a little-known Chinese entrepreneur set out to match TSMC and Samsung, but never commercially produced an advanced semiconductor
body:
China has spent billions of dollars in recent years trying to catch up to the world’s most advanced semiconductor makers.
Two foundry projects, led in part by a little-known entrepreneur then in his 30s, help show why China has yet to succeed.
